name: Classical Music
description: Part of a broad generalization about the structure and function of music throughout history across the globe, describing traditions distinct from Traditional Folk Music and popular music.

sub_genres.name: Buganda Royal Court Music
sub_genres.description: Highest traditional and refined musical forms of Buganda, reserved for the Kabaka (the king of Buganda).

sub_genres.name: East Asian Classical Music
sub_genres.description: Covers all the forms of pan-East Asian Classical Music sharing origins in Chinese Classical Music.

sub_genres.name: Inkiranya
sub_genres.description: Influential drumming style originating in Burundi carried out by a percussion ensemble.

sub_genres.name: Kete
sub_genres.description: Traditional percussive style played at special occasions in the courts of high ranking Asante chieftains.

sub_genres.name: Maqāmic Music
sub_genres.description: Originating in the Middle East and founded upon maqāmāt scales, encompassing an extensive and diverse cultural and musical legacy that spans from Morocco to Southeast Asia.

sub_genres.name: Minyue
sub_genres.description: Modernized composition for Chinese instruments on the basis of Chinese Folk Music, incorporating aspects of Western Classical Music.

sub_genres.name: Pìobaireachd
sub_genres.description: Art tradition which originated in the Scottish Highlands, usually associated with the Great Highland bagpipes.

sub_genres.name: South Asian Classical Music
sub_genres.description: Meta-genre that covers the diverse forms of Classical Music from South Asia.

sub_genres.name: Southeast Asian Classical Music
sub_genres.description: Formal music developed in Southeast Asian countries (Burma, Cambodia, Thailand, Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, East Timor, Brunei Darussalam) usually in form of gong-chime orchestras such as gamelan, kulintang and pi phat.

sub_genres.name: Tibetan Buddhist Chant
sub_genres.description: Ritual vocal music of the Tibetan Buddhist faith characterized by its low pitch, droning repetitiousness, and frequent use of overtone singing.

sub_genres.name: Western Classical Music
sub_genres.description: Broad range of art music associated with the aristocracy that originated in Europe around 500 AD.
